title: How to Make Caribbean Carob Cake

steps.headline: Grease and base-line a 22cm/8 1/2 or 9inch round deep cake tin.
Mix the carob powder with 4tbsp cold water.
Cream the margarine and sugar together until and fluffy.
Then gradually whisk in the carob mixture, the eggs and vanilla essence.
Spread the mixture in the tin and make a slight hollow in the center.
Bake for about 1 hour or until a skewer/fork inserted in the middle comes out clean, with no mixture sticking to it.
Leave in the tin until almost cold.
Then turn out and peel away the lining paper.
Cut the cake horizontally into 3 layers.
To make the filling soften the cheese in a bowl.
Then beat in the fromage fries and sugar.
Use one-third of the filling to sandwich the cake layers together.
Spread the remaining filling over the top and sides of the cake.
coarsely grate the carob bar and sprinkle over the top and sides of the cake.
Put it in the refrigerator until needed.

text: Grease and base-line a 22cm/8 1/2 or 9inch round deep cake tin.  Set the oven to 180C/350F/gas4.  Mix the carob powder with 4tbsp cold water.  Cream the margarine and sugar together until and fluffy.  Then gradually whisk in the carob mixture, the eggs and vanilla essence.  Gently fold in the flour.  Spread the mixture in the tin and make a slight hollow in the center.  Bake for about 1 hour or until a skewer/fork inserted in the middle comes out clean, with no mixture sticking to it.  Leave in the tin until almost cold.  Then turn out and peel away the lining paper.  Cut the cake horizontally into 3 layers.  To make the filling soften the cheese in a bowl.  Then beat in the fromage fries and sugar.  Mix in the crushed pineapple.  Use one-third of the filling to sandwich the cake layers together.  Spread the remaining filling over the top and sides of the cake.  coarsely grate the carob bar and sprinkle over the top and sides of the cake.  Put it in the refrigerator until needed.  Finished.
